title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: The children node does not appear in the data set editor when changing the data source for a data set in the query tab. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor, navigate to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to one that has no database/table/column information. Actual result: The children node does not appear in the data set editor page of the query tab. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to one that does not have any database/table/column information. 4. Observe that the children node does not appear in the data set editor page of the query tab. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
